title: Protein Shakes Low in Calories: Nutrition
meta_description: Discover protein shakes low in calories with high protein, low carbs and fat—get per-serving nutrition, tweaks, and FAQs for your low-cal shake options.
h1: Protein Shakes Low in Calories: Nutrition
assumptions: Whey protein isolate powder (30 g scoop) mixed with water; no added sugars, flavors like vanilla; ~250 ml total volume.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, flavor, powder type, and mixing liquid. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A low-calorie protein shake typically has ~110 kcal and 25 g protein per serving.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with product packaging.

tweaks.label: Mix with skim milk instead of water
Add fresh berries (50 g) for flavor

faqs.q: What makes protein shakes low in calories?
faqs.a: Low-cal shakes use minimal carbs/sugars, low-fat protein sources, and water as the base—aim for under 150 kcal per serving.

faqs.q: How much protein in low-calorie shakes?
faqs.a: Typically 20–25 g protein per shake, making them ideal for muscle support without excess calories.

faqs.q: Are low-calorie protein shakes good for weight loss?
faqs.a: Yes, they provide satiety from protein while keeping calories low, but pair with a balanced diet.

faqs.q: What brands offer protein shakes low in calories?
faqs.a: Options like Isopure Zero Carb, Premier Protein Clear, or Orgain Organic—check for <120 kcal servings.

faqs.q: Can I make my own low-calorie protein shake?
faqs.a: Yes, blend protein powder with water, ice, and zero-cal flavorings; avoid high-cal add-ins like nut butters.
